cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest through the northern Leeward Islands toward the Turks & Caicos, Bahamas and then curving toward the Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida / Florida Keys (most likely Sunday evening)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watches now posted for Turks and Caicos, southeastern Bahamas, and eastern Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings in effect for northern Leeward Islands, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and parts of the Dominican Republic
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, Bahamas, Cuba north coast, and southeast U.S. coast within 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) increasingly likely late Sunday; hurricane-force winds possible if Irma tracks closer to the east coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft surge along the Space Coast including Port Canaveral if Irma parallels or makes landfall in South Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall possible with locally higher amounts, leading to flash-flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large breakers and dangerous seas will close the channel; prolonged swell and rip currents, possible tornadoes in outer rain-bands.
